title: Sensitivity to initial conditions and Lyapunov exponent of a quasiperiodic system.
abstract: The dynamics of a quasiperiodic map is analysed both in the presence and in the absence of weak noise. it is shown that, in the presence of weak noise, a strange chaotic attractor with a negative Lyapunov exponent and sensitive dependence on initial conditions can exist in the system. This means that the type of motion of a fluctuating system cannot be classified only by the sign of the leading Lyapunov exponent

        Sensitivity to initial conditions and Lyapunov exponent of a quasiperiodic system.</dc:title><dc:creator>

        QC Physics</dc:subject><dc:description>
        The dynamics of a quasiperiodic map is analysed both in the presence and in the absence of weak noise. it is shown that, in the presence of weak noise, a strange chaotic attractor with a negative Lyapunov exponent and sensitive dependence on initial conditions can exist in the system. This means that the type of motion of a fluctuating system cannot be classified only by the sign of the leading Lyapunov exponent.</dc:description><dc:date>
